title: 2024 Lamborghini Revuelto
description: This 2024 Lamborghini Revuelto is powered by a naturally aspirated 6.5-liter V12 and a trio of electric motors that drive all four wheels through an eight-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The electric motors are fed by a 3.8-kWh lithium-ion battery located in the central tunnel, while Nero Noctis carbon-fiber body panels are complemented by aluminum scissor doors and an active rear wing. The Sportiva-theme cockpit is trimmed in Nero Ade leather and Alcantara with Verde Scandal accents, and it features power-adjustable seats, a passenger-side display screen, a carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel, and a smartphone interface system. This Revuelto was purchased new by the seller from F.C. Kerbeck & Sons of Palmyra, New Jersey, and now has 549 miles. It is offered in Boca Raton, Florida, with accessories, a scale model of the car, a clean Carfax report, and a Montana title in the name of the seller's LLC.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2024 Lamborghini Revuelto at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #188,953.
text: This 2024 Lamborghini Revuelto is powered by a naturally aspirated 6.5-liter V12 and a trio of electric motors that drive all four wheels through an eight-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The electric motors are fed by a 3.8-kWh lithium-ion battery located in the central tunnel, while Nero Noctis carbon-fiber body panels are complemented by aluminum scissor doors and an active rear wing. Additional equipment includes a suspension-lift system, carbon-ceramic brakes, staggered-diameter gloss black wheels, and front and rear parking sensors. The Sportiva-theme cockpit is trimmed in Nero Ade leather and Alcantara with Verde Scandal accents, and it features power-adjustable seats, a passenger-side display screen, a carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel, and a smartphone interface system. This Revuelto was purchased new by the seller from F.C. Kerbeck & Sons of Palmyra, New Jersey, and now has 549 miles. It is offered in Boca Raton, Florida, with accessories, a scale model of the car, a clean Carfax report, and a Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC. Launched as a replacement for the range-topping Aventador in 2023, the Revuelto was designed by Mitja Borkert at Lamborghini Centro Stile and is the marque’s first production plug-in hybrid model. The car utilizes a carbon-fiber monocoque and body panels as well as aluminum scissor doors, thermoplastic front and rear bumpers, and an active rear wing. This example is finished in Nero Noctis and features Y-shaped LED daytime running lights and taillights as well as front and rear parking sensors, a partially exposed engine bay, and twin exhaust pipes that exit through the rear valance. The seller tells us that the bodywork has been ceramic-coated and fitted with paint protection film. The gloss black-finished 21″ and 22″ Altanero wheels feature Lamborghini crest center caps and titanium rim bolts, and they are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza Sport tires measuring 265/30 up front and 355/25 out back. The suspension incorporates front and rear double wishbones along with adaptive dampers at all four corners, and the car is equipped with a suspension lift system. Stopping power is provided by Verde Chiaro-finished 10-piston front calipers and four-piston rear units over staggered-diameter carbon-ceramic calipers. The cockpit features an optional Sportiva-theme interior with power-adjustable seats trimmed in Nero Ade leather with Verde Scandal inserts and contrasting stitching. Color-coordinated upholstery extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Additional appointments include an Alcantara headliner and interior accents as well as exposed carbon-fiber trim, bi-color floor mats, automatic climate control, a 9.1″ screen mounted ahead of the passenger, and an infotainment system featuring an 8.4″ vertical infotainment touchscreen, navigation, and Apple CarPlay and Android Auto connectivity. The carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel features leather side grips as well as controls for 13 selectable driving modes, and it sits ahead of column-mounted shift paddles and a 12.3″ configurable digital screen. The odometer shows 549 miles. Driver aids consist of the Surround Assistance and Parking packs. The naturally aspirated 6.5-liter V12 is factory rated at 814 horsepower, and it is assisted by a trio of electric motors for a combined power output of 1,001 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. A 3.8-kWh battery pack is mounted in the central tunnel between the seats. Power is routed to all four wheels via a Graziano an eight-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. Factory accessories including a car cover, seat and steering wheel covers, tire cushions, a charging cable, a battery tender, and a scale model of the car are included in the sale and can be seen in the gallery.
